dotConnect for Oracle support@devart.com
Readme  

Product Description

dotConnect for Oracle, formerly known as OraDirect .NET, is an enhanced data provider for Oracle that builds on ADO.NET technology to present a complete solution for developing Oracle-based database applications. As part of the Devart database application development framework, dotConnect for Oracle offers both high performance native connectivity to the Oracle database and a number of innovative development tools and technologies. dotConnect for Oracle introduces new approaches for designing application architecture, boosts productivity, and leverages database application implementation.

dotConnect for Oracle is a scalable data access solution developed with wide adaptability in mind. It can be successfully used in WinForms, ASP.NET, two-tier, multi-tier applications; within the ASP.NET Provider Model; in conjunction with the Enterprise Library; under .NET Compact Framework, Mono Framework and so on. Depending on the edition you choose, dotConnect for Oracle can be used as powerful ADO.NET data provider, or an effective application development framework.

Requirements

Prior to running Setup to install the dotConnect for Oracle, you must already have the .NET Framework 2.0, 3.0, 3.5, 4.0, 4.5, or 4.6 installed on the computer. If the .NET Framework is not installed, the Setup program for the provider will fail.

To use full set of Oracle features you have to have Oracle client software installed. If you do not want to install it, you can use Direct mode, in which dotConnect for Oracle communicates with Oracle server without intermediate libraries.

Installation

dotConnect for Oracle is provided as single setup package that contains all required files and documentation. By default all files are installed in "Program Files\Devart\dotConnect\Oracle" folder. The setup program also adds the necessary assemblies to the Global Assembly Cache.

If you have problems with registering dotConnect for Oracle components in IDE toolbox, refer to corresponding topic in dotConnect for Oracle documentation.

Documentation and Informational Resources

dotConnect for Oracle has exhaustive documentation integrated into IDE, where every aspect of using the product is covered in details. The documentation contains reference information and set of articles that enlight most of dotConnect for Oracle features. You can also download the documentation in chm format from our site.

If you have a question regarding dotConnect for Oracle, take a look through list of Frequently Asked Questions. Common problems with viewing documentation are described there as well.

There is a forum dedicated to dotConnect for Oracle.

Getting Support

If your problem is not covered in documentation or FAQ, consult the Getting Support topic of dotConnect for Oracle documentation prior to contacting the support team through the forum or e-mail.
